text.text_translated: Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, people started to live in an organised way. This was the start of human society with rules and culture. We see this in their cave paintings. No one knows the link between this and language. Brains did not get bigger quickly. But humans became more clever. Their thinking also became not simple. Did using language make their brains change and get better? Or did their more not simple brains start to use language?
